meanings.definition: The process of converting into silica.
meanings.sent1: The silicification of the rock took many years.
meanings.sent2: Minerals undergo silicification to become silica.
meanings.sent3: The silicification of the sand was so slow, it felt like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas went through a silicification process, becoming solid and unchanging.
meanings.sent5: The silicification of the glass made it strong and durable.

meanings.definition: The act of impregnating or combining with silica.
meanings.sent1: Silicification of the soil improved its quality for plant growth.
meanings.sent2: The silicification of the metal enhanced its strength.
meanings.sent3: The silicification of the water made it sparkle like diamonds.
meanings.sent4: His words had a silicification effect on her beliefs, making them stronger.
meanings.sent5: The silicification of the clay made it resistant to heat.
